title: C++ Arrays

title: Access the Elements of an Array
text:
You access an array element by referring to the index number inside square 
brackets [].

This statement accesses the value of the first element in 
cars:

Example

  string cars[4] = {"Volvo", "BMW", "Ford", "Mazda"};
  cout << cars[0];// Outputs Volvo

Try it Yourself »

Note: Array indexes start with 0: [0] is the first element. [1] is the second 
element, etc.
